content:
TITLE: Installing vxe-table via NPM DESCRIPTION: This command installs the vxe-table package using npm. It is used to add the vxe-table library to your project for use in Vue applications. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm install vxe-table@next ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing vxe-table via NPM DESCRIPTION: This command installs the vxe-table package using npm. The @next tag ensures you get the latest version. It assumes Node.js and npm are already installed. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.en.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm install vxe-table@next ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Install vxe-table with NPM DESCRIPTION: This command installs the vxe-table package from NPM. It is a prerequisite for using the vxe-table component in a Vue project. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.ja-JP.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm install vxe-table@next ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing vxe-table via npm DESCRIPTION: Installs the vxe-table component using npm. This command downloads and adds the vxe-table package to your project's dependencies. The @next tag installs the latest version of the table. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.zh-TW.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm install vxe-table@next ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Import and use VxeTable in Vue DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to import and use the VxeTable component and its associated CSS in a Vue application. It uses the `createApp` function to register the component globally. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.ja-JP.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // ... import VxeTable from 'vxe-table' import 'vxe-table/lib/style.css' // ... createApp(App).use(VxeTable).mount('#app') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using vxe-table in a Vue application (JavaScript) DESCRIPTION: Imports and registers the vxe-table component in a Vue application. It also imports the associated CSS styles for the table. This snippet demonstrates how to integrate vxe-table into a Vue 3 application. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.zh-TW.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // ... import VxeTable from 'vxe-table' import 'vxe-table/lib/style.css' // ... createApp(App).use(VxeTable).mount('#app') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing vxe-table in Vue DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to import and use the vxe-table component in a Vue application. It also imports the required CSS styles. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // ... import VxeTable from 'vxe-table' import 'vxe-table/lib/style.css' // ... createApp(App).use(VxeTable).mount('#app') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using vxe-table in a Vue Application DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to import and use vxe-table in a Vue application. It imports the VxeTable component and its associated CSS styles and registers it with the Vue app. The createApp function is used to create a Vue application instance. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.en.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // ... import VxeTable from 'vxe-table' import 'vxe-table/lib/style.css' // ... createApp(App).use(VxeTable).mount('#app') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic VxeTable Example in Vue DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates a basic implementation of VxeTable in a Vue component. It shows how to define a table with columns, bind data, and use features like sequence numbers and column groups. It requires the `vue` and `vxe-table` dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.ja-JP.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic vxe-table Example DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates a basic implementation of vxe-table in a Vue component. It defines a table with sequence, name, role, sex, and address columns, and binds the table data to the `tableData` property. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic vxe-table Example (HTML & TypeScript) DESCRIPTION: A basic example demonstrating how to define a vxe-table component with columns and data in a Vue application. It shows how to use vxe-column components to define table columns and bind data to the table. This includes the HTML template and the corresponding TypeScript script setup. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.zh-TW.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: vxe-table Example in Vue Template DESCRIPTION: This is an example of how to use vxe-table within a Vue template. It defines a simple table with sequence, name, role, sex, and address columns. The table data is bound to the `tableData` ref. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.en.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Import and use VxeTable and VxeUI in Vue DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to import and use both the VxeTable and VxeUI components and their associated CSS in a Vue application. It uses the `createApp` function to register the components globally. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.ja-JP.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // ... import VxeTable from 'vxe-table' import 'vxe-table/lib/style.css' // ... import VxeUI from 'vxe-pc-ui' import 'vxe-pc-ui/lib/style.css' // ... createApp(App).use(VxeUI).use(VxeTable).mount('#app') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing vxe-table and UI in Vue DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to import both vxe-table and vxe-pc-ui (a UI library) in a Vue application. It includes importing the CSS styles for both libraries. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // ... import VxeTable from 'vxe-table' import 'vxe-table/lib/style.css' // ... import VxeUI from 'vxe-pc-ui' import 'vxe-pc-ui/lib/style.css' // ... createApp(App).use(VxeUI).use(VxeTable).mount('#app') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using vxe-table with a UI Library (JavaScript) DESCRIPTION: Imports and registers both vxe-table and vxe-pc-ui components in a Vue application. This integrates the table component with a UI library, providing a consistent look and feel. Both the table's and UI library's CSS are imported. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.zh-TW.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // ... import VxeTable from 'vxe-table' import 'vxe-table/lib/style.css' // ... import VxeUI from 'vxe-pc-ui' import 'vxe-pc-ui/lib/style.css' // ... createApp(App).use(VxeUI).use(VxeTable).mount('#app') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using vxe-table and vxe-pc-ui in a Vue Application DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to import and use both vxe-table and vxe-pc-ui in a Vue application. It imports both components and their respective CSS styles, then registers them with the Vue app. Dependencies include VxeTable, VxeUI and their CSS. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.en.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // ... import VxeTable from 'vxe-table' import 'vxe-table/lib/style.css' // ... import VxeUI from 'vxe-pc-ui' import 'vxe-pc-ui/lib/style.css' // ... createApp(App).use(VxeUI).use(VxeTable).mount('#app') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Start local development server using NPM DESCRIPTION: This command runs the `serve` script defined in the `package.json` file. It typically starts a local development server for testing and development. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.ja-JP.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run serve ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Local Debugging via NPM DESCRIPTION: This command starts a local development server for debugging. It assumes Node.js and npm are already installed and the `serve` script is defined in `package.json`. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.en.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run serve ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Local Development Server via npm DESCRIPTION: This command starts the local development server for the vxe-table project. It allows developers to test and debug the component in a local environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.zh-TW.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run serve ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running local debugging via NPM DESCRIPTION: This command executes the `serve` script defined in the `package.json` file, typically used to start a local development server for debugging. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run serve ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Compiling and Packaging via NPM DESCRIPTION: This command compiles and packages the project, generating the 'es' and 'lib' directories. It assumes Node.js and npm are already installed and the `lib` script is defined in `package.json`. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.en.md#_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run lib ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Compiling and packaging via NPM DESCRIPTION: This command executes the `lib` script defined in the `package.json` file, usually used to compile and package the project into distributable formats (e.g., ES modules, CommonJS). SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run lib ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Library Files via npm DESCRIPTION: This command compiles and packages the vxe-table component into distributable library files (es, lib). This is used for creating production-ready builds of the component. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.zh-TW.md#_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run lib ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Build library using NPM DESCRIPTION: This command runs the `lib` script defined in the `package.json` file. It's typically used to compile and package the library for distribution, generating `es` and `lib` directories. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.ja-JP.md#_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run lib ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Update project dependencies using NPM DESCRIPTION: This command runs the `update` script defined in the `package.json` file. It's typically used to update project dependencies to their latest versions. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.ja-JP.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run update ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Dependencies via NPM DESCRIPTION: This command is used to update project dependencies. It assumes Node.js and npm are already installed. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.en.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run update ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating dependencies via NPM DESCRIPTION: This command executes the `update` script defined in the `package.json` file, used to update project dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run update ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Dependencies via npm DESCRIPTION: This command is used to update the dependencies for the vxe-table project. It's necessary to run this command before starting development or testing. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.zh-TW.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` npm run update ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using vxe-table with CDN DESCRIPTION: This HTML code demonstrates how to use vxe-table with a CDN. It includes the necessary CSS and JavaScript files, and also includes a basic vxe-table component in the Vue template. It initializes the table with sample data. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Include VxeTable and dependencies from CDN DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet demonstrates how to include the VxeTable component and its dependencies from a CDN (Content Delivery Network). It includes links to the CSS stylesheet, Vue.js, xe-utils, VxeUI, and VxeTable JavaScript files. Note that using a CDN is generally not recommended for production environments. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.ja-JP.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using vxe-table via CDN DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to include vxe-table in a project using CDN links. It includes links to the CSS styles and JavaScript files for vxe-table, vxe-pc-ui, xe-utils and Vue.js. Remember to specify the version to avoid breaking changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.en.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using vxe-table via CDN (HTML) DESCRIPTION: Includes vxe-table and its dependencies via CDN links in an HTML file. It's crucial to lock the version to prevent breaking changes. This is a quick way to integrate the component for testing or demonstration purposes, but it's NOT recommended for production. SOURCE: https://github.com/x-extends/vxe-table/blob/master/README.zh-TW.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ```
